Description: Lower body sherd of large Chian Animal Chalice or Grand Style pottery chalice or heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; band of double-outlined lotus buds in added white outline with added red centres between red and white bands; exterior: three bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Chalice kraters are found only in the Animal Chalice and Grand Styles and the interior and exterior decoration is typical of both styles. The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd were burned during the bombings in London in 1941.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1352) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 71 (Other Accession Number)
